name: hieratic
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
formal relating to or like priests, or ceremonies performed by priests: He spoke words of power in a hieratic ritual language. She raised both her arms in a hieratic gesture, as if in some kind of blessing. These indigenous traditions are hieratic and they are little known to outsiders.
language, history
  specialized in or relating to the ancient Egyptian writing that developed from early hieroglyphics and was used, especially by priests, from around 3200–3000 BCE until the development of demotic in around 650 BCE: The illustration shows fragments of funerary papyri inscribed in hieratic script. None of the new owners of these antiquities was able to read the hieroglyphic, hieratic, and demotic texts with which the monuments were covered. Compare
demotic
hieroglyphic
More examplesFewer examplesThe work is similar to Stravinsky's Symphony of Psalms in its hieratic solemnity.The arias were sung with stylized hieratic gestures.Students who wanted to discuss novels and poems heard instead about "theory," often expressed in mysterious, hieratic language.Her beautiful face in this image—hieratic, calm and noble—brings to mind the wonderful figures of the romanesque portal of the cathedral of Chartres.
